Material used.Description: The experiment was conducted using recombinant human α-synuclein protein.

Readout description.Result Description: The A30P mutant fails to undergo a typical structural transition from random coil to a-helix.
The A53T mutant shows no significant difference from WT in its secondary structure upon membrane-binding.
The double mutant A53T/A30P is defective in membrane binding, similar to the A30P mutant.

Biological replicates.Description: The experiments were repeated several times to confirm their reproducibility.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was analyzed multiple times.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type α-synuclein was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Buffer alone was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Standard deviation and mean values were calculated.

Material used.Description: Brain PE/PS MLVs were used as the lipid source.

Readout description.Result Description: Significantly less A30P α-synuclein was found in the membrane fraction.
A53T α-synuclein was found in the membrane fraction similarly to WT.
Double mutant A53T/A30P α-synuclein was defective in membrane binding, similar to the A30P mutant.

Biological replicates.Description: The experiments were repeated several times to confirm their reproducibility.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was analyzed multiple times.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type α-synuclein was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Buffer alone was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Standard deviation and mean values were calculated.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Significant fraction of α-synuclein in the membrane pellet

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Negligible fraction of α-synuclein in the membrane pellet

Material used.Description: Brain PE/PS MLVs were used as the lipid source.

Readout description.Result Description: A30P mutant did not significantly alter the pressure versus repeat distance relationship of the pure lipid bilayer.
A53T mutant showed similar behavior to WT α-synuclein in altering the pressure versus repeat distance relationship.
Double mutant A53T/A30P showed similar behavior to A30P mutant in altering the pressure versus repeat distance relationship.

Biological replicates.Description: The experiments were repeated several times to confirm their reproducibility.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was analyzed multiple times.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type α-synuclein was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Buffer alone was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Standard deviation and mean values were calculated.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Repeat spacing alteration greater than 10% compared to pure lipid bilayer

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Repeat spacing alteration less than 5% compared to pure lipid bilayer
